case_vignette: A 47-year-old woman comes to the physician because of repetitive tongue twisting and abnormal movements of the hands and legs that started several days ago. She has a 2-year history of schizophrenia that has been controlled with fluphenazine. Two weeks ago, she was switched to risperidone. Examination shows protrusion of the tongue and smacking of the lips. She makes twisting movements of the arms and frequently taps her right foot.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having repetitive tongue twisting and weird movements in my hands and legs over the past several days.
Have you had any difficulty speaking or swallowing?
No, I haven't had any difficulty speaking or swallowing.
Have you had any history of seizures or epilepsy?
No, I don't have any history of seizures or epilepsy.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or stress levels?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my sleep patterns or stress levels.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or exercise routine?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my diet or exercise routine.
Have you had any recent injuries or illnesses?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries or illnesses.
Have you had any family history of similar symptoms?
I haven't mentioned any family history of similar symptoms.
Have you had any recent travel to areas with high altitude or exposure to toxins?
No, I haven't had any recent travel to high altitude areas or exposure to toxins.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication regimen?
Yes, I was switched from fluphenazine to risperidone two weeks ago.
Final Diagnosis: Tardive Dyskinesia.
